agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Jasper, Lake, Newton, Porter, Pulaski, and Starke County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Jasper, Lake, Newton, Porter, Pulaski, or Starke County

agency_desc: Offers self-help support groups, networking and information throughout the state in which members help each other stay drug-free and share recovery experiences.
service_description: Offers support groups in which members help each other stay drug-free and share recovery experiences. This area has meetings in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tippecanoe, and White County.
site_details: Call or visit website for meeting times and locations. -- Call and leave a message to receive a call-back from a recovering addict. -- All meetings are walk-in only.
site_schedule: Automated Information Line: Daily 24 Hours -- Meetings: Vary
site_eligibility: Closed Meetings: Addicts or those who think they may have a drug problem -- Open Meetings: Anyone wishing to experience narcotics anonymous fellowship

agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
service_description: Offers statewide virtual training for persons interested in becoming licensed for foster care. Foster parents receive 24-hour staff support, counseling services, financial reimbursement, support groups, and respite care. Eligible candidates must be physically and emotionally able to handle challenges presented. Both single persons and married couples are welcome.
site_details: Visit website to complete online interest form, register for upcoming pre-service training dates, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- Able to pass a criminal history, child abuse, and sexual abuse registry check -- Able to meet state foster care licensing requirements

agency_desc: A nonprofit law firm that provides free civil legal assistance to eligible low-income people throughout Indiana. "ILS helps clients who are faced with legal problems that harm their ability to have such basics as food, shelter, income, medical care or personal safety."
service_description: Provides legal guidance and representation to low-income individuals in civil matters, such as family law, senior law, consumer law, housing issues, and public benefits. Preference is given to legal problems that prevent clients from meeting their basic needs. No criminal or fee-generating cases accepted.
site_details: Call during service hours or complete online application. Be prepared to answer questions about household income and assets.
site_eligibility: Income 125% of Federal Poverty Level -- With a civil legal issue that does not generate fees

agency_name: BUREAU OF CHILD DEVELOPMENT SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A government agency assuring Indiana families with infants and toddlers experiencing developmental delays or disabilities have access to early intervention services close to home when they need them through a coordinated system of local inter-agency councils called First Steps.
site_name: FIRST STEPS OF NORTHWEST INDIANA - CLUSTER A
service_description: Serves as an entry point for infants and toddlers who have or are at risk for developmental delays. Services include home-based special instruction; occupational, physical, and speech therapy; access to health and social services; and case management.
taxonomy_name: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
nameLevel3: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Jasper, Lake, La Porte, Newton, Porter, Pulaski or Starke county -- Ages 0-3 -- With, or at risk for, developmental delays

agency_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency providing services for individuals with developmental disabilities.
site_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - DISTRICT 1
service_name: HOME AND COMMUNITY BASED MEDICAID WAIVERS / CAREGIVER SUPPORT SERVICES - DISTRICT 1
service_description: Provides funding for home and residential care services to enable persons with developmental disabilities to live as independently as possible. Client services include developmental evaluation; case management; and referrals to supported living, sheltered employment, and home-care providers. There is a wait list for Medicaid Waivers; however, caregiver support services funds may be available in the meantime.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application.
site_eligibility: With a developmental disability, including intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, epilepsy, autism, down syndrome, or a condition that results in a similar impairment -- Onset for the condition was prior to age 22 -- The disability creates substantial functional limitations (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for all veteran issues, including providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouse or children of a veteran

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.

service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

service_description: Answers questions about state income taxes, provides state tax forms, handles state tax collections and assists with setting up payment arrangements, and submits completed state tax returns (paper filing only). agency_desc: A nonprofit agency working to address and correct the problem of low minority participation in the building trades by recruiting and training minority and women workers for the union construction industry in Indiana.
service_description: Offers pre-apprenticeship training for electrical work, plumbing, carpentry, painting, bricklaying, steel fabrication, and heavy equipment operation. Enrollment is determined by application and personal interview. After completing classroom work, students are encouraged to apply for full apprenticeship programs, and are placed on job sites to gain experience in the industry while they await acceptance into a program.
site_details: Visit the website to apply. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- With high school diploma or equivalent -- With valid Indiana driver's license -- With reliable transportation -- Able to pass a drug test

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office serves Cass, Fulton, Grant, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Jasper, Lake, La Porte, Newton, Porter, Pulaski, andf Starke County.

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
agency_desc: A government program with a mission to provide a broad range of counseling, outreach, and referral services to eligible veterans in order to help them make a satisfying post-war readjustment to civilian life.

service_description: Offers a peer support program using reintegration counseling to help combat veterans and their families cope with stress, transition into civilian life, and reduce barriers to care. taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or walk in during regular business hours; call to make an after hours or weekend appointment
site_eligibility: United States combat war veterans and their immediate families

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that is a safe emergency shelter and provider of services for survivors of domestic violence and their dependent children.
service_description: Provides emergency shelter for survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault. One-on-one support is given to adult and child survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, or incest. Services include support groups, parenting sessions, legal advocacy, personal empowerment and independent living training, and referral to other community resources, including mental health services.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Persons fleeing a domestic violence situation or survivors of sexual assault or human trafficking -- Must be 18 or older -- Women or Men with or without dependents

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides adult day programs, and vocational programs to persons in Northwest Indiana.
service_description: Provides interpreters for facilitating communication between hearing persons and persons with hearing loss. Also provides support services for housing, money management, and employment issues to persons with hearing loss and their families. Maintains catalogs of information on assistive listening devices such as alarms, doorbells, video phone information, and clocks; orders are placed upon request. Offers training for the INTRAC telephone relay service and the equipment distribution program. Provides applications for the state's INTRAC program for free equipment as well.
site_details: Call to begin application process.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that works to promote, encourage and enhance services to improve social, educational, and economic conditions of African Americans and other minority groups.
service_description: Offers scholarship opportunities to high school students in Northwest Indiana, seeking continued education at a post-secondary school. agency_name: WEST CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - LAKE COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: WEST CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - LAKE COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: Provides temporary emergency housing for single women and women with children. Support services including housing search assistance and referrals to community resources. Operates as an emergency warming center during the winter when temperatures are too cold for seniors to stay in their homes all day. Serves as an overnight shelter as well.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Calumet Township of Lake County -- Women or women with children

site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Vary; call to confirm details

agency_desc: A health care organization providing nursing and rehabilitative facility for elderly and disabled individuals.
service_description: Provides a long-term or intermediate-stay housing option for seniors and persons with a disability in need of 24-hour skilled nursing services. A special care unit is available for persons diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease and other dementia-related diseases. Short-term rehabilitative services for persons recovering from an injury, illness, or surgery are also available.
site_details: Call for information or  to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Unable to complete daily living activities (based on assessment) -- Additional admission and insurance criteria may apply

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
service_description: Offers programs for all ages, including all-season sports, weight-lifting, aerobics, and swimming lessons/water aerobics. Members pay dues for open access to the fitness center, fitness classes, and pool/sauna and receive discounted rates for special programs. Nonmembers pay fixed fees for classes.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to join or register for specific programs. Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open; membership not required for most programs, but members do receive discounts on fees.

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Maintains and operates three public housing complexes (West Calumet Complex, Nicosia Senior Building, and Hunter Senior Building) for low-income families, seniors, and persons with disabilities.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or visit the website to submit an application.
site_eligibility: Low income -- US citizens and eligible immigrants -- Priority given to persons age 57 or older, persons receiving SSI disability benefits, and working families

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in in the city of East Chicago in Lake County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list for East Chicago city is currently CLOSED. No applications are available at this time. Visit website to check if wait list is open or closed. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Offers financial assistance to first time homebuyers on the down payment, principal reduction, or closing costs associated with purchasing a home. Assistance will be made to eligible households on a first-come, first-serve and one-time basis.  Funds may assist qualified applicants with up to 10% of the home's purchase price or $10,000, whichever is less.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment to complete the application; bring all required documents. -- Visit website to review the program brochure and document checklist prior to appointment. -- Call with questions.
site_eligibility: Purchasing a home in the City of Gary. -- Must not have owned a home as principal residence within a period of three years prior to applying. -- Household income $47,250 or less for one-person household, $54,000 or less for two-person household, $60,750 or less for three-person household, $67,500 or less for four-person household, $72,900 or less for five-person household, and $78,300 or less for six-person household.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that promotes the wellbeing of all people whose lives have been touched by cancer, by offering support, education, and encouragement.

site_details: Call to register for a class or to schedule an orientation session
site_eligibility: With cancer diagnosis or the family/friend of a cancer patient

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides an emergency youth shelter and counseling services for those in need.
service_description: Provides sites where youth age 10-17 who are in crisis can go for help. Youth can also text the word SAFE and their current location to 44357. The reply provides an address of the nearest Safe Place site and contact number for the local youth shelter. Sites are marked with a yellow-and-black Safe Place sign; some sites may include fire stations, public libraries, schools, community centers, boys and girls clubs, and YMCA locations.
site_details: Walk in to Safe Place and inform a staff person of the crisis situation. -- Call the shelter hotline or text SAFE and current location to 44357.
site_schedule: Safe Place Text: Daily 24 hours -- Safe Place Sites: Varies by location
site_eligibility: Living in Lake or Porter County -- Age 10-17 -- Facing a crisis (lost, in danger, with a drunk or unsafe driver, experiencing problems at home, including abuse or neglect)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides an emergency youth shelter and counseling services for those in need.
service_description: Provides a 24-hour emergency shelter for children age 10-17 depending on the referral source. Youth may be homeless, abused or neglected, runaways, or referred from DCS, Juvenile Probation, or local law enforcement. Services include individual, group, and family counseling to in-house clients, tutoring, transportation to home, school, medical/other appointments, recreation, referrals, and follow-up outcome determination for one year. Length of stay depends on type of program.
site_details: Youth are referred through a Safe Place site in Lake or Porter County, through law enforcement when found as a runaway or homeless youth, or through the Department of Child Services or Juvenile Probation.
site_eligibility: Age 10-17 -- Other eligibility requirements dependent on program; call for information

Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.

site_details: Call or walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Jasper, Lake, Newton, Porter, Pulaski, or Starke County

agency_name: EVERYBODY COUNTS CENTER FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides independent living skills, instruction, and advocacy services to seniors and those with disabilities in need in Lake and Porter Counties.
site_name: EVERYBODY COUNTS CENTER FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING
service_description: Offers information, training, support, and advocacy to help seniors and those with disabilities achieve independence. Individualized on-site or in-home training may include building life skills, increasing mobility/travel, managing personal-care assistants, and exercising legal rights for Lake and Porter Counties. Does not provide any type of transportation service or housing assistance.

nameLevel4: Protection and Advocacy for Individuals With Disabilities
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Seniors -OR- persons with a disability

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering services that empower and support children and their families.
service_description: Provides child care vouchers for low-income families who are working or in school. Families under 100% of the federal poverty guidelines may receive free child care; families between 100-127% of the federal poverty guidelines may receive child care at a sliding scale rate.
site_details: Call, email, or visit website for information. -- To apply: Visit website https://earlyedconnect.fssa.in.gov/onlineApp/home -OR- Be referred through TANF IMPACT -OR- Be referred by the Indiana Department of Child Services (DCS)
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana -- Child receiving assistance must be a US Citizen or qualified legal alien [Note: Some requirements may be waived for licensed foster parents seeking care for foster children, or for parents with a referral from the Department of Child Services (DCS) or from TANF/IMPACT]. -- Parent(s) of children birth through age 13 (or up to 18, if child has special needs) -- Working or enrolled in school -- Income at or below 127% of the federal poverty guidelines

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering services that empower and support children and their families.
service_description: Provides prenatal and early childhood support through a home-based program that combines parenting education, economic self-sufficiency planning, and health and social services for low-income families. Income guidelines may be waived for children with special needs or disabilities. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at several locations.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 10am-7pm; Monthly 1st Sat 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and mothers with children up to age three -- Household income at or below 100% federal poverty guidelines

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering services that empower and support children and their families.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering services that empower and support children and their families.
service_name: CHILD CARE RESOURCE AND REFERRAL SERVICES
service_description: Assists parents in finding child care that matches their individual needs, including providers that offer sliding-scale fees and accept Child Care and Development Fund (CCDF) vouchers. Options include licensed centers, licensed homes, registered ministries, preschools, before- and after-school programs, and summer day camps. Information and referral services are free and may be accessed by phone, in person, or online.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information, or to apply.
site_schedule: Mon-Thurs 8am-5pm CST (7am-4pm EST); Fri 8am-4:30pm CST (7am-3:30pm EST)
site_eligibility: Parent/Guardian seeking child care

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering services that empower and support children and their families.
service_description: Provides home-based case management and advocacy to help families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connecting families to local resources.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an assessment; no referral necessary. -- A case manager will come to the home to conduct initial assessment.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 10am-7pm; Monthly 1st Sat 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: Living in Lake County -- Child under age 18 in the home -- Families who do not have an open DCS -- Families who do not meet the criteria for participation in the Healthy Families program -- Families that have been referred by a community resource or self-referred due to a determination that family functioning can be improved and child abuse and neglect can be prevented

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF NORTHWEST INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF NORTHWEST INDIANA
service_description: Builds and sells homes to eligible low-income persons in Lake County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call for an application.
site_eligibility: Living in Lake County -- Household income between 30%-80% of area median (call or see website for current amounts) -- Able to make payments (steady employment history or equivalent income) -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in the city of Hammond in Lake County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation).
site_details: There may be a wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers. Please call or visit, www.hammondhousing.org, for the most current information.
site_eligibility: Meet income guidelines -- Seniors or persons with disabilities -- US citizens and eligible immigrants

site_eligibility: Meet income guidelines -- Seniors or persons with disabilities -- US citizens and eligible immigrants

service_description: Offers free classes covering a variety of computer skills, including basic computer and Internet skills, Microsoft Office programs, email, and more.
site_details: Call or visit the website for class schedule or to register. www.hammond.lib.in.us
site_eligibility: Living in the City of Hammond in Lake County -- Aged 18 and older

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_eligibility: Living in the towns of Cedar Lake, Dyer, or Saint John -- Not used this pantry within the past 2 weeks

service_description: Operates a pet food pantry to persons in need. Limited service area.

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that works to advocate for the underserved, develop and facilitate partnerships, and address systemic community health disparities.
service_description: Provides information and educational programs for local at-risk minorities. Services include healthy lifestyle management, breast cancer awareness, smoking cessation, health screenings, and other wellness programs for community groups.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open; primarily serves Lake County

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that works to advocate for the underserved, develop and facilitate partnerships, and address systemic community health disparities.
service_description: Trains individuals to serve as liaisons for local health organizations and community members. Training topics cover specific health needs, patient advocacy, communication skills, and health policies. Orientation and program commitment of 20 or 40 hours is required. Participants receive certification and assistance with work placement opportunities in a health field.
site_details: Call to register for training.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers community thrift shops to support charitable outreach missions.
service_description: Provides discounted clothing to people in need. Selections are available for children through adult; sizes and styles may vary. Proceeds go toward mission services provided to local communities and throughout the United States and Central and South America. Volunteer opportunities are available.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing food packages to families in need living in Hobart.
address_2: Service Center For The School City Of Hobart
service_description: Provides food packages to those in need living in Hobart.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Living in Hobart -- Limit one visit per week.

service_description: Provides a smoking cessation program with individualized counseling for pregnant women. Requires four prenatal meetings during pregnancy and then monthly meetings after delivery. Clients may select a smoking support partner, who resides with them, to enroll.  Participants who remain smoke-free throughout the pregnancy and first year of the baby's birth may each qualify for a diaper voucher for up to 12 months after baby is born.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Lake County resident -- Pregnant women, with or without a smoking support partner (living in same household)* Currently smoking or smoked at least 3 months prior to pregnancy* Willing to quit smoking and submit to a breath/saliva test

service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from a Methodist Hospitals provider. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income. Applications are also available from financial counselors located at all Methodist Hospitals campuses.
site_details: Patients MUST submit an application for financial assistance in order to be considered for assistance. Call the Patient Financial Services office or contact a financial counselor at any Methodist Hospitals hospital to request a Financial Assistance Application. The Financial Assistance Application may also be submitted online.
site_eligibility: Received, receiving, or planning to receive medically necessary health care services from Methodist Hospitals (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Low to moderate income (determined by application assessment)

service_description: Offers a monthly lunch for seniors, including entertainment, guest speakers, and door prizes. Reservations should be made in advance. Participants are allowed to bring additional guest.
site_details: Call in advance to register and obtain a reservation number. Be prepared to provide name, address, phone number, and birth date.
site_schedule: Reservation Line: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm -- Lunch: Monthly Wed noon (doors open at 10:30am)
site_eligibility: Living in North Township of Lake County -- Age 55 or older

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides a monthly food pantry to community members in need living; limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Gary

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering a food and clothing pantry to persons in need.
service_description: Provides a food pantry of nonperishable and perishable items to persons in need. Clients select from a list of items based on need which are then packaged for pickup. Limited service area.
site_details: Call or email for information. -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: drive through. fill out paper to receive number, number will be called for drive through pick up.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering a food and clothing pantry to persons in need.
service_description: Offers gently-used clothing to people of all ages in need. Selections range from children to adult sizes. Items vary by donation. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A health care agency that provides nursing and rehabilitative facility for seniors and persons with a disability.
service_description: Provides a long-term or intermediate-stay housing option for seniors and persons with a disability in need of 24-hour skilled nursing services. A special care unit is available for persons diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease and other dementia-related diseases.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Unable to complete daily living activities (based on assessment) -- Additional admission and insurance criteria may apply

agency_desc: A commercial agency that provides professional interpreting services for persons who are deaf and hard of hearing.

service_description: Provides interpreters to facilitate communication between deaf and hearing persons. Offers interpreting services for events for Deaf/Hard of Hearing (HOH) persons such as public hearings.
site_details: Call to request an interpreter. -- Be prepared to offer appointment details, such as date, location, and reason for interpreting service.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network that offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of medical services and emergency care.
service_description: Operates inpatient units for severe psychiatric and mental health treatment. Detoxification services for alcohol may be available. A 24-hour phone crisis intervention is available for persons experiencing a mental health or addictions crisis.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for an initial consultation and assessment.
site_eligibility: In need of mental health or addiction treatment (based on assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network affiliated with Franciscan Health offering a full-service hospital with a wide range of medical services and emergency care.
service_description: Offers a walk-in clinic for minor injuries and common illnesses, immunizations, and physicals. Typically serves non-chronic conditions, including allergic reactions, coughs, cuts, bites, sprains, strains, sore throats, stomach aches, and fevers.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial agency that delivers home medical equipment, oxygen, and gas services.
service_description: Lends, sells, and repairs home medical equipment for people in need. Items range from hospital beds, commodes, wheelchairs, walkers, crutches, monitoring devices, joint splints, feeding tubes, and respiratory aides. Delivery services are available upon request. Direct patient services require a physician's order and clinical documentation to support need. Selected insurance plans apply.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or to request delivery.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-5pm -- Answering Service: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Persons in need of medical equipment and have physician's order and clinical documentation to support need.

agency_name: JESSE BROWN VETERANS AFFAIRS MEDICAL CENTER
agency_desc: A government healthcare agency that provides complete medical, surgical, and neurological care for eligible veterans. Also provides nursing home care for eligible veterans.
site_name: JESSE BROWN VETERANS AFFAIRS MEDICAL CENTER - ADAM BENJAMIN JR. PRIMARY AND SPECIALTY CARE CLINIC
service_description: Provides outpatient primary medical and mental health care for veterans.
site_details: Call for intake information and to schedule an appointment. Eligibility must be determined before service is provided.
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US veterans (including reservists/National Guard)

agency_name: JESSE BROWN VETERANS AFFAIRS MEDICAL CENTER

service_description: Provides outpatient primary medical and mental health care for veterans.

site_details: Call for intake information and to schedule an appointment. Eligibility must be determined before service is provided.
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US veterans (including reservists/National Guard)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides educational and therapeutic riding instruction for persons with special needs.
service_description: Provides a therapeutic horseback riding program for persons with a disability.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Age 4 or older -- Persons with disabilities -- Must weigh less than 185 pounds (exceptions may be made on a case-by-case basis)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
service_description: Offers programs for all ages, including all-season sports, weight-lifting, aerobics, and swimming lessons/water aerobics. Members pay dues for open access to the fitness center, fitness classes, and pool/sauna and receive discounted rates for special programs. Nonmembers pay fixed fees for classes.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to join or register for specific programs; Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers scholarships and funding for schools, churches, municipal agencies, and nonprofit organizations.
service_description: Offers scholarship opportunities to high school seniors and non-traditional adult students in East Chicago, seeking continued education at a post-secondary school.
site_details: Visit the website for information and download the application.
site_eligibility: High school seniors -OR- non-traditional adult students

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Hobart Township of Lake County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Hobart Township of Lake County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on property description and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Hobart Township of Lake County

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in to complete an intake form; provided current contact information -- Clients are scheduled bi-weekly to pick up their food items. -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: drive through.
site_eligibility: Open, limit two visits per month

agency_desc: An organization that provides quality of life services for all members with in the Hobart city limits.
service_description: Offers a variety of recreational and social activities for seniors, aged 55 and older. The facility includes a computer learning center, dining area, and fitness center. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in; new members complete an application. -- Check website for the schedule of activities
site_eligibility: Age 55 or older

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program.
site_details: There may be a wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers. Please call or visit, www.garyhousing.org, for the most current information.
site_eligibility: Preference given to families with children, seniors, and people with disabilities

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program.
site_details: There may be a wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers. Please call or visit, www.garyhousing.org, for the most current information.
site_eligibility: Preference given to families with children, seniors, and people with disabilities

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering case management, information, and other services for persons affected by HIV.
service_description: Provides information about HIV/AIDS to persons and groups. Prevention counseling is also available for persons at risk of contracting or transmitting the HIV virus.
site_details: Call for information or to request prevention counseling services.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering case management, information, and other services for persons affected by HIV.
service_description: Provides free, confidential HIV testing by appointment or on a walk-in basis.
site_details: Walk in or call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open (parental consent required for those under age 13)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering case management, information, and other services for persons affected by HIV.
service_description: Provides mental and physical health care referrals and care coordination free of charge for HIV positive persons.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Diagnosed HIV positive -- Age 17 or older

agency_desc: A utility company providing natural gas and electric service to the northern third of Indiana.
service_description: Provides electricity for customers within set boundaries in northern Indiana. Customer service representatives provide account information, connection/disconnection services, payment options, and outage information and reporting.
site_details: Visit the website or call for outage information, payment information, or to start or stop service. To start service, be prepared to provide: Security number -- Address where service is needed -- Place of employment (name, address, and telephone number) --Landlord's name, address, and telephone number
site_schedule: Customer Service: Mon-Fri 7am-7pm -- Electric Emergencies: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Addresses located within NIPSCO electric service area, which includes parts of Benton, Carroll, DeKalb, Elkhart, Fulton, Jasper, Kosciusko, La Porte, Lagrange, Lake, Marshall,   Newton, Noble, Porter, Pulaski, St Joseph, Starke, Steuben, Warren, and White County

agency_desc: A utility company providing natural gas and electric service to the northern third of Indiana.
service_description: Provides natural gas service to select areas in northern Indiana. Various payment assistance programs are available to income-eligible households.
site_details: Visit the website or call for outage information, payment information, or to start or stop service. To start service, be prepared to provide: Security number -- Address where service is needed -- Place of employment (name, address, and telephone number) --Landlord's name, address, and telephone number
site_schedule: Customer Service: Mon-Fri 7am-7pm -- Gas Leak Emergencies: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Requirements for assistance programs vary; call for details

agency_desc: A utility company providing natural gas and electric service to the northern third of Indiana.
address_1: Nipsco Residential Energy Efficiency Programs C/o Trc
service_name: INCOME-QUALIFIED WEATHERIZATION AND REFRIGERATOR REPLACEMENT PROGRAM
service_description: Provides free home energy use assessments and weatherization services for income-eligible NIPSCO customers. Services may include the replacement or addition of shower heads, faucet aerators, light bulbs, water heater pipe wraps, furnace filter whistles, and attic insulation. Refrigerator replacement may also be offered for homes with an older, inefficient refrigerator. This program does not include any water heater or furnace repair/replacement.
site_details: Call TRC for more information or to schedule a home assessment.
site_eligibility: With an active NIPSCO residential electric and/or gas account -- Household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines -- Not received weatherization services in the past 10 years -- For refrigerator replacement: - With a working, non-ENERGY STAR certified refrigerator manufactured before 2002 - Note: Must first undergo weatherization services

agency_desc: A utility company providing natural gas and electric service to the northern third of Indiana.
address_1: Nipsco Residential Energy Efficiency Programs C/o Trc
service_name: INCOME-QUALIFIED WEATHERIZATION AND REFRIGERATOR REPLACEMENT PROGRAM
service_description: Provides free home energy use assessments and weatherization services for income-eligible NIPSCO customers. Services may include the replacement or addition of shower heads, faucet aerators, light bulbs, water heater pipe wraps, furnace filter whistles, and attic insulation. Refrigerator replacement may also be offered for homes with an older, inefficient refrigerator. This program does not include any water heater or furnace repair/replacement.
site_details: Call TRC for more information or to schedule a home assessment.
site_eligibility: With an active NIPSCO residential electric and/or gas account -- Household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines -- Not received weatherization services in the past 10 years -- For refrigerator replacement: - With a working, non-ENERGY STAR certified refrigerator manufactured before 2002 - Note: Must first undergo weatherization services

agency_desc: A utility company providing natural gas and electric service to the northern third of Indiana.
address_1: Nipsco Residential Energy Efficiency Programs C/o Trc
service_description: Offers an incentive program for NIPSCO residential electric customers wishing to recycle a refrigerator, freezer, window air conditioner or dehumidifier. Appliance pickup is available for most counties and included at no charge. Eligible households will receive a $50 for each refrigerator and/or freezer or a $15 for each air conditioner and/or dehumidifier; limit two large units and two small units per customer address per calendar year.
site_details: Call TRC for more information or to schedule appliance pick-up.
site_eligibility: With an active NIPSCO residential electric account -- With a refrigerator or freezer between 10 cubic feet - 30 cubic feet (Units must be clean, empty, defrosted, and in working condition) -- Limit two units per customer address per calendar year

agency_desc: An agency that operates as the Area Agency on Aging (Area I), Community Action Agency, Information and Assistance (2-1-1 call center) and designated WIC (Women, Infant & Children) provider serving low income, elderly & those with disabilities living in Jasper, Lake, Newton, Porter, Pulaski, and Starke County.
site_name: NORTHWEST INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION - INFORMATION ASSISTANCE/AREA 1 AGENCY ON AGING
service_description: Assists seniors and persons with disabilities in applying for and accessing funding for supportive living services. Funding options may include Medicaid Waivers, CHOICE vouchers, or block grants. Ongoing case management, care coordination, and in-home services are provided for those who qualify. In some cases, subsidies may be used to pay a family member to provide the care.
site_details: Call for phone-based assistance or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older, or any age or with physical disabilities -- Unable to perform tasks of daily living without assistance (based on assessment) -- Income requirements vary by funding source

agency_desc: An agency that operates as the Area Agency on Aging (Area I), Community Action Agency, Information and Assistance (2-1-1 call center) and designated WIC (Women, Infant & Children) provider serving low income, elderly & those with disabilities living in Jasper, Lake, Newton, Porter, Pulaski, and Starke County.
site_name: NORTHWEST INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION - INFORMATION ASSISTANCE/AREA 1 AGENCY ON AGING
service_description: Assists seniors and persons with disabilities in applying for and accessing funding for supportive living services. Funding options may include Medicaid Waivers, CHOICE vouchers, or block grants. Ongoing case management, care coordination, and in-home services are provided for those who qualify. In some cases, subsidies may be used to pay a family member to provide the care.
site_details: Call for phone-based assistance or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older, or any age or with physical disabilities -- Unable to perform tasks of daily living without assistance (based on assessment) -- Income requirements vary by funding source

site_details: Visit the website or call for information.
site_eligibility: Volunteers: Age 21 or older; Under age 18 can accompany adult parent/guardian volunteer -- Able to pass criminal background check

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth. Their mission is "helping people become independent and advocating for those who can't".
service_description: Offers free, objective information on Medicare, Medicare supplements, Medicare Advantage plans, Medicaid, long-term care insurance, and prescription assistance programs. SHIP counselors are trained and certified by the Indiana Department of Insurance.
site_details: Call 219-794-1829 and select 1 at the auto attendant to speak with a SHIP counselor.
site_eligibility: People who are or will soon become eligible for Medicare

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth. Their mission is "helping people become independent and advocating for those who can't".
service_description: Helps provide individuals and families with the skills and tools needed to become financially successful. Provides Individual Development Accounts (IDA), and the Self-Sufficiency program for those that qualify.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Current Employed Residents of IN -- Earned household income must be at or below 200% of the federal poverty guidelines; 1 Person: $23,760 annually -- 2 People: $32,040 annually -- 3 People: $40,320 annually -- 4 People: $48,600 annually -- 5 People: $56,880 annually -- 6 People: $61,160 annually -- 7 People: $73,460 annually -- 8 People: $81,780 annually(Add $4,160 for each additional person)

service_description: Provides free weatherization of owner-occupied and rental residences in Lake County. Household must meet income guidelines to be eligible. Services may include attic insulation, caulking, weather-stripping, furnace repair and replacement, and heat duct and water pipe insulation.
site_details: New Clients: Call Northwest Indiana Community Action's Information & Assistance department   219-794-1829 press 1 at auto attendant to request a weatherization application packet. -- Previous Clients: Call the Weatherization Program Supervisor ext. 2451 for further directions  on how to complete the weatherization application process.
site_eligibility: Living in Lake County -- Household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Landlord permission required for rental units

agency_desc: Distributes USDA commodities and donated/purchased food to qualified charitable organizations.

site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -- Household income at or below 130% of the Federal Poverty Level

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the city.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for the city of East Chicago for youth age 3 months through 18 years who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine and flu shots (fall through spring).
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 3 months-18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the city.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of the city of East Chicago in Lake County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards, such as mold, lead, radon, pest control, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves the city of East Chicago.

site_name: LAKE COUNTY PROSECUTOR - ADULT PROTECTIVE SERVICES
service_description: Investigates allegations of abuse, neglect, self-neglect, and exploitation of endangered adults (adults who are incapable of caring for themselves or managing their property due to physical or mental incapacity.) Indiana law requires persons to report all cases of suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult to the nearest Adult Protective Services office or to law enforcement agents. All reports are confidential.
site_details: Call to make a report; provide as much detail about the situation as possible. --For emergencies or after-hours reports, please call local police or county dispatch.
site_eligibility: Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

site_eligibility: Living within the county

service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Lake County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards, such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Lake County, except Gary and East Chicago

service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 6 months or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Lake County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Lake County, Superior Courts handle small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Lake County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Lake County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Lake County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Lake County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8:45am-3:45pm -- Walk-ins/Calls Accepted: Mon and Fri 8:45am -- Wed 1:15pm
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Lake County Courts

service_description: Oversees court cases involving Lake County minors, including petitions for emancipation, children in need of services (CHINS), and minors accused of delinquency or status offenses.

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register.
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 6am-5pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Lake County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Lake County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Lake County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Lake County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.

agency_name: LAKE COUNTY COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT
agency_desc: A county department that provides business capital and housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides loans to homeowners with low to moderate income to repair, improve their homes, or to remove health and safety hazards. Only 40% of the loan may go toward non-code improvements. Interest rate is set at 3% on a 20-year term. Maximum loan ranges up to $30,000.
taxonomy_name: Home Maintenance and Minor Repair Grants/Loans
nameLevel4: Home Maintenance and Minor Repair Grants/Loans
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Owner-occupied single-family household -- Household income between 50%-80% of HUD area median (current amounts will be given)

agency_name: LAKE COUNTY COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT
agency_desc: A county department that provides business capital and housing assistance programs.
service_description: Assists individuals who are intersted in starting a small business, expanding their current business, or new equipment needs. Loan amount is determined on a case by case basis.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment and request an application.
site_eligibility: Persons who own or want to start a business --  With a business plan -- Additional criteria may apply (by law)

agency_name: LAKE COUNTY COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT
agency_desc: A county department that provides business capital and housing assistance programs.
service_description: Offers support on the mortgage loan process before and after the purchase. Low-cost mortgage loans and down payment assistance is available to low-to moderate-income buyers. Funds may assist up to $5000 per household for qualified applicants. Referrals will be given for recommended housing counseling.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Household income up to 80% of HUD area median (current amounts will be given)

agency_name: LAKE COUNTY COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT
agency_desc: A county department that provides business capital and housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides emergency funds to homeowners with unforseen damages to property that may incur and code-related violations. Assistance is available for repairs, such as water leaks, replacement for heating systems, wind damage repairs, or falling tree removal. Funds may be offered up to $10,000 when available. A wait list may apply.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment and request an application.
site_eligibility: Household income up to 50% of HUD area median (current amounts will be given) -- Additional restrictions and terms apply

agency_name: LAKE COUNTY COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT
agency_desc: A county department that provides business capital and housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides deferred loans with no interest for eligible, single-family homeowners. Funds may pay for energy efficiency improvements and essential repairs, such as heating, air conditioning, septic systems, weatherization, water proofing, and windows. Maximum loan ranges up to $30,000. Repayment is not due until whenever the owner sells the home. A wait list may apply.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment and complete the application.
site_eligibility: Owner-occupied single-family household -- Household income between 50%-80% of HUD area median (current amounts will be given)

Provides acute inpatient services to help individuals experiencing suicidal or homicidal ideations, change in behaviors, decrease in participation in activities of daily living,

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment. Visit the website to fill out an application or pick one up during scheduled hours.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Call and leave a voicemail with name and phone number. -- Staff will return call to schedule pick-up time.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial agency that provides gently used low cost furniture to individual and families in need.
service_description: A resale shop that provides low cost, gently used furniture items to persons in need. Furniture items arriving daily. Call for availability. Payment plans available for qualified clients.
site_details: Walk-in or call for item availability; be prepared to provide bank account and routing numbers for payment plan.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, Fri, and Sat 10am-7:30pm; Wed 10am-6pm
site_eligibility: Open service area -- Low income (for payment plan option)

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization offering social events and educational training to Blind and vision-impaired individuals.
service_description: Offers basic computer instruction to persons who are visually impaired. Equipment, including desktop computers and tablets, are provided for training and general use.
site_details: Call to reserve a computer or IPAD.
site_eligibility: With vision impairment

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization offering social events and educational training to Blind and vision-impaired individuals.
service_description: Offers free classes to persons who are visually impaired. Subjects include learning Braille, personal management, basic homemaking, fitness and nutrition education classes, and arts and crafts.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: With vision impairment

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization that provides education in the community and crisis intervention services and advocacy for survivors of trauma.
service_description: A Child Sexual Abuse education program, for adults who work with youths and to teach children personal safety strategies. Students learn what constitutes healthy and respectful social relationships, how to set personal boundaries, how to identify human trafficking, how to identify teen dating violence, and how to respect the boundaries of others. The program teaches students how to identify trusted adults, as well as how and where to reach out for help.
site_details: Call for more information and to schedule a presentation.
site_eligibility: Youth serving organizations

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization that provides education in the community and crisis intervention services and advocacy for survivors of trauma.
service_description: Crisis Intervention Services is a 24-hour rape response service. taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

agency_desc: A commercial business that provides non-medical transportation services.

agency_desc: A community-based, primary health care organization that offers clinical and dental services for individuals in Lake County.
service_description: Provides primary care and comprehensive family medical service, including women's health, family planning, ultrasounds,  pediatrics and well baby check-ups, vision and hearing screenings, and laboratory services. The clinic also offers physical exams, HIV testing, and pregnancy testing. Sliding-scale fees are available for income eligible clients.
site_details: Appointments preferred; walk-ins accepted on a limited basis.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A community-based, primary health care organization that offers clinical and dental services for individuals in Lake County.
service_description: Provides a smoking cessation program with individualized counseling for pregnant women. Requires four prenatal meetings during pregnancy and then monthly meetings after deliver. Clients may select a smoking support partner, who resides with them, to enroll. Participants who remain smoke-free throughout the pregnancy and first year of baby's birth may each qualify for a $25 diaper voucher each month, to be redeemed at a Walmart or CVS store.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment for an initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana -- Pregnant women, with or without a smoking support partner (living in same household) -- Currently smoking or smoked at least 3 months prior to pregnancy -- Willing to quit smoking and submit to a breath/saliva test
